description: From retro- (“backwards”) + past participle of Latin mingō (“I urinate”).

adjectives.description: retromingent (comparative more retromingent, superlative most retromingent)

entries.meaning: (not comparable) That urinates backwards; also used of such urination.
examples: It sat down at last and, as if to express once and for all its disenchantment with the whole sum of canine existence, delivered itself of a retromingent puddle on the beautiful Shiraz.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) An animal that urinates backwards, such as the camel, hippo or raccoon.
examples: I confess by reason of the postick and backward position of the feminine parts in quadrupedes, they can hardly admit the substitution of a protrusion, effectuall unto masculine generation; except it be in Retromingents, and such as couple backward.
